47 namespace parquet {
48 
49 class PARQUET_EXPORT LevelEncoder {
50  public:
51  LevelEncoder();
52  ~LevelEncoder();
53 
54  static int MaxBufferSize(Encoding::type encoding, int16_t max_level,
55  int num_buffered_values);
56 
57  // Initialize the LevelEncoder.
58  void Init(Encoding::type encoding, int16_t max_level, int num_buffered_values,
59  uint8_t* data, int data_size);
60 
61  // Encodes a batch of levels from an array and returns the number of levels encoded
62  int Encode(int batch_size, const int16_t* levels);
63 
64  int32_t len() {
65  if (encoding_ != Encoding::RLE) {
66  throw ParquetException("Only implemented for RLE encoding");
67  }
68  return rle_length_;
69  }
70 
71  private:
72  int bit_width_;
73  int rle_length_;
74  Encoding::type encoding_;
75  std::unique_ptr<::arrow::util::RleEncoder> rle_encoder_;
76  std::unique_ptr<::arrow::BitUtil::BitWriter> bit_packed_encoder_;
77 };
78 
79 class PageWriter {
80  public:
81  virtual ~PageWriter() {}
82 
83  static std::unique_ptr<PageWriter> Open(
84  OutputStream* sink, Compression::type codec, ColumnChunkMetaDataBuilder* metadata,
85  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool(),
86  bool buffered_row_group = false);
87 
88  // The Column Writer decides if dictionary encoding is used if set and
89  // if the dictionary encoding has fallen back to default encoding on reaching dictionary
90  // page limit
91  virtual void Close(bool has_dictionary, bool fallback) = 0;
92 
93  virtual int64_t WriteDataPage(const CompressedDataPage& page) = 0;
94 
95  virtual int64_t WriteDictionaryPage(const DictionaryPage& page) = 0;
96 
97  virtual bool has_compressor() = 0;
98 
99  virtual void Compress(const Buffer& src_buffer, ResizableBuffer* dest_buffer) = 0;
100 };
101 
102 static constexpr int WRITE_BATCH_SIZE = 1000;
103 class PARQUET_EXPORT ColumnWriter {
104  public:
105  ColumnWriter(ColumnChunkMetaDataBuilder*, std::unique_ptr<PageWriter>,
106  bool has_dictionary, Encoding::type encoding,
107  const WriterProperties* properties);
108 
109  virtual ~ColumnWriter() = default;
110 
111  static std::shared_ptr<ColumnWriter> Make(ColumnChunkMetaDataBuilder*,
112  std::unique_ptr<PageWriter>,
113  const WriterProperties* properties);
114 
115  Type::type type() const { return descr_->physical_type(); }
116 
117  const ColumnDescriptor* descr() const { return descr_; }
118 
124  int64_t Close();
125 
126  int64_t rows_written() const { return rows_written_; }
127 
128  // Only considers the size of the compressed pages + page header
129  // Some values might be still buffered an not written to a page yet
130  int64_t total_compressed_bytes() const { return total_compressed_bytes_; }
131 
132  int64_t total_bytes_written() const { return total_bytes_written_; }
133 
134  const WriterProperties* properties() { return properties_; }
135 
136  protected:
137  virtual std::shared_ptr<Buffer> GetValuesBuffer() = 0;
138 
139  // Serializes Dictionary Page if enabled
140  virtual void WriteDictionaryPage() = 0;
141 
142  // Checks if the Dictionary Page size limit is reached
143  // If the limit is reached, the Dictionary and Data Pages are serialized
144  // The encoding is switched to PLAIN
145 
146  virtual void CheckDictionarySizeLimit() = 0;
147 
148  // Plain-encoded statistics of the current page
149  virtual EncodedStatistics GetPageStatistics() = 0;
150 
151  // Plain-encoded statistics of the whole chunk
152  virtual EncodedStatistics GetChunkStatistics() = 0;
153 
154  // Merges page statistics into chunk statistics, then resets the values
155  virtual void ResetPageStatistics() = 0;
156 
157  // Adds Data Pages to an in memory buffer in dictionary encoding mode
158  // Serializes the Data Pages in other encoding modes
159  void AddDataPage();
160 
161  // Serializes Data Pages
162  void WriteDataPage(const CompressedDataPage& page);
163 
164  // Write multiple definition levels
165  void WriteDefinitionLevels(int64_t num_levels, const int16_t* levels);
166 
167  // Write multiple repetition levels
168  void WriteRepetitionLevels(int64_t num_levels, const int16_t* levels);
169 
170  // RLE encode the src_buffer into dest_buffer and return the encoded size
171  int64_t RleEncodeLevels(const Buffer& src_buffer, ResizableBuffer* dest_buffer,
172  int16_t max_level);
173 
174  // Serialize the buffered Data Pages
175  void FlushBufferedDataPages();
176 
177  ColumnChunkMetaDataBuilder* metadata_;
178  const ColumnDescriptor* descr_;
179 
180  std::unique_ptr<PageWriter> pager_;
181 
182  bool has_dictionary_;
183  Encoding::type encoding_;
184  const WriterProperties* properties_;
185 
186  LevelEncoder level_encoder_;
187 
188  ::arrow::MemoryPool* allocator_;
189  ChunkedAllocator pool_;
190 
191  // The total number of values stored in the data page. This is the maximum of
192  // the number of encoded definition levels or encoded values. For
193  // non-repeated, required columns, this is equal to the number of encoded
194  // values. For repeated or optional values, there may be fewer data values
195  // than levels, and this tells you how many encoded levels there are in that
196  // case.
197  int64_t num_buffered_values_;
198 
199  // The total number of stored values. For repeated or optional values, this
200  // number may be lower than num_buffered_values_.
201  int64_t num_buffered_encoded_values_;
202 
203  // Total number of rows written with this ColumnWriter
204  int rows_written_;
205 
206  // Records the total number of bytes written by the serializer
207  int64_t total_bytes_written_;
208 
209  // Records the current number of compressed bytes in a column
210  int64_t total_compressed_bytes_;
211 
212  // Flag to check if the Writer has been closed
213  bool closed_;
214 
215  // Flag to infer if dictionary encoding has fallen back to PLAIN
216  bool fallback_;
217 
218  std::unique_ptr<InMemoryOutputStream> definition_levels_sink_;
219  std::unique_ptr<InMemoryOutputStream> repetition_levels_sink_;
220 
221  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> definition_levels_rle_;
222  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> repetition_levels_rle_;
223 
224  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> uncompressed_data_;
225  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> compressed_data_;
226 
227  std::vector<CompressedDataPage> data_pages_;
228 
229  private:
230  void InitSinks();
231 };
232 
233 // API to write values to a single column. This is the main client facing API.
234 template <typename DType>
235 class PARQUET_TEMPLATE_CLASS_EXPORT TypedColumnWriter : public ColumnWriter {
236  public:
237  typedef typename DType::c_type T;
238 
239  TypedColumnWriter(ColumnChunkMetaDataBuilder* metadata,
240  std::unique_ptr<PageWriter> pager, Encoding::type encoding,
241  const WriterProperties* properties);
242 
243  // Write a batch of repetition levels, definition levels, and values to the
244  // column.
245  void WriteBatch(int64_t num_values, const int16_t* def_levels,
246  const int16_t* rep_levels, const T* values);
247 
274  void WriteBatchSpaced(int64_t num_values, const int16_t* def_levels,
275  const int16_t* rep_levels, const uint8_t* valid_bits,
276  int64_t valid_bits_offset, const T* values);
277 
278  // Estimated size of the values that are not written to a page yet
279  int64_t EstimatedBufferedValueBytes() const {
280  return current_encoder_->EstimatedDataEncodedSize();
281  }
282 
283  protected:
284  std::shared_ptr<Buffer> GetValuesBuffer() override {
285  return current_encoder_->FlushValues();
286  }
287  void WriteDictionaryPage() override;
288  void CheckDictionarySizeLimit() override;
289  EncodedStatistics GetPageStatistics() override;
290  EncodedStatistics GetChunkStatistics() override;
291  void ResetPageStatistics() override;
292 
293  private:
294  int64_t WriteMiniBatch(int64_t num_values, const int16_t* def_levels,
295  const int16_t* rep_levels, const T* values);
296 
297  int64_t WriteMiniBatchSpaced(int64_t num_values, const int16_t* def_levels,
298  const int16_t* rep_levels, const uint8_t* valid_bits,
299  int64_t valid_bits_offset, const T* values,
300  int64_t* num_spaced_written);
301 
302  typedef Encoder<DType> EncoderType;
303 
304  // Write values to a temporary buffer before they are encoded into pages
305  void WriteValues(int64_t num_values, const T* values);
306  void WriteValuesSpaced(int64_t num_values, const uint8_t* valid_bits,
307  int64_t valid_bits_offset, const T* values);
308  std::unique_ptr<EncoderType> current_encoder_;
309 
310  typedef TypedRowGroupStatistics<DType> TypedStats;
311  std::unique_ptr<TypedStats> page_statistics_;
312  std::unique_ptr<TypedStats> chunk_statistics_;
313 };
314 
315 typedef TypedColumnWriter<BooleanType> BoolWriter;
316 typedef TypedColumnWriter<Int32Type> Int32Writer;
317 typedef TypedColumnWriter<Int64Type> Int64Writer;
318 typedef TypedColumnWriter<Int96Type> Int96Writer;
319 typedef TypedColumnWriter<FloatType> FloatWriter;
320 typedef TypedColumnWriter<DoubleType> DoubleWriter;
321 typedef TypedColumnWriter<ByteArrayType> ByteArrayWriter;
322 typedef TypedColumnWriter<FLBAType> FixedLenByteArrayWriter;
323 
324 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<BooleanType>;
325 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<Int32Type>;
326 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<Int64Type>;
327 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<Int96Type>;
328 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<FloatType>;
329 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<DoubleType>;
330 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<ByteArrayType>;
331 PARQUET_EXTERN_TEMPLATE TypedColumnWriter<FLBAType>;
332 
333 } // namespace parquet
